item.title: Analyzing Hand Cricket using Game Theory
item.description: Hand cricket is a popular game among children in India. I analyzed it using game theory and got my findings published at FSTTCS, a well-known CS theory conference!
item.dc:creator: Eklavya Sharma

item.title: The Math behind Juggling
item.description: This article explains how math can be applied to juggling, a seemingly non-mathematical area. This gives us more insight into what really goes on in a juggling pattern and helps us automate the process of finding new juggling patterns.
item.dc:creator: Eklavya Sharma

item.title: Generalizing Segment Trees
item.description: How I generalized segment trees by expressing range query outputs as elements of a monoid and update operations as functions.
item.dc:creator: Eklavya Sharma
